|  [createBlock(type, props, children, patchFlag, dynamicProps)](runtime-core.createblock.md) | Create a block root vnode. Takes the same exact arguments as <code>createVNode</code>. A block root keeps track of dynamic nodes within the block in the <code>dynamicChildren</code> array. |
|  [createCommentVNode(text, asBlock)](runtime-core.createcommentvnode.md) |  |
|  [createHydrationRenderer(options)](runtime-core.createhydrationrenderer.md) |  |
|  [createRenderer(options)](runtime-core.createrenderer.md) | The createRenderer function accepts two generic arguments: HostNode and HostElement, corresponding to Node and Element types in the host environment. For example, for runtime-dom, HostNode would be the DOM <code>Node</code> interface and HostElement would be the DOM <code>Element</code> interface.<!-- -->Custom renderers can pass in the platform specific types like this:
```js
const { render, createApp } = createRenderer<Node, Element>({
  patchProp,
  ...nodeOps
})

```
 |

|  [onDeactivated(hook, target)](./runtime-core.ondeactivated.md) |  |
|  [openBlock(disableTracking)](./runtime-core.openblock.md) | Open a block. This must be called before <code>createBlock</code>. It cannot be part of <code>createBlock</code> because the children of the block are evaluated before <code>createBlock</code> itself is called. The generated code typically looks like this:
```js
function render() {
  return (openBlock(),createBlock('div', null, [...]))
}

```
disableTracking is true when creating a v-for fragment block, since a v-for fragment always diffs its children. |
|  [popScopeId()](runtime-core.popscopeid.md) |  |
|  [provide(key, value)](runtime-core.provide.md) |  |
|  [pushScopeId(id)](runtime-core.pushscopeid.md) |  |
|  [queuePostFlushCb(cb)](runtime-core.queuepostflushcb.md) |  |
|  [registerRuntimeCompiler(\_compile)](runtime-core.registerruntimecompiler.md) | For runtime-dom to register the compiler. Note the exported method uses any to avoid d.ts relying on the compiler types. |
|  [renderList(source, renderItem)](runtime-core.renderlist.md) | v-for string  |
|  [renderList(source, renderItem)](runtime-core.renderlist_1.md) | v-for number |
|  [renderList(source, renderItem)](runtime-core.renderlist_2.md) | v-for array |
|  [renderList(source, renderItem)](runtime-core.renderlist_3.md) | v-for iterable |

|  [resolveTransitionHooks(vnode, { appear, persisted, onBeforeEnter, onEnter, onAfterEnter, onEnterCancelled, onBeforeLeave, onLeave, onAfterLeave, onLeaveCancelled, onBeforeAppear, onAppear, onAfterAppear, onAppearCancelled }, state, instance)](runtime-core.resolvetransitionhooks.md) |  |
|  [setBlockTracking(value)](runtime-core.setblocktracking.md) | Block tracking sometimes needs to be disabled, for example during the creation of a tree that needs to be cached by v-once. The compiler generates code like this:
```js
_cache[1] || (
  setBlockTracking(-1),
  _cache[1] = createVNode(...),
  setBlockTracking(1),
  _cache[1]
)

```
 |
|  [setTransitionHooks(vnode, hooks)](./runtime-core.settransitionhooks.md) |  |
|  [toHandlers(obj)](./runtime-core.tohandlers.md) | For prefixing keys in v-on="obj" with "on"  |
|  [transformVNodeArgs(transformer)](./runtime-core.transformvnodeargs.md) | Internal API for registering an arguments transform for createVNode used for creating stubs in the test-utils It is \*internal\* but needs to be exposed for test-utils to pick up proper typings |
